intro: Dorychnium, commonly known as the common burr or field bindweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are characterized by their hairy stems and distinctive, spiny fruits that aid in seed dispersal. Dorychnium species are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of climates. They produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or reddish in color. The genus includes several species, some of which are considered weeds in agricultural settings.
